attributes.action: Honour the agreement this government signed at the Laeken summit in 2001 to increase state pensions to 40 per cent of the National Average Wage by 2007
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
The EU summit at Laeken in 2001 ratified a proposal that all member states should endeavour to attain a level of 40 per cent of the the National Average wage as their basic state pension by 2007.
One European country pays 100 per cent of the National Average wage, some pay 80 per cent, others pay 50 per cent. The UK pays about 18 per cent.
This government embraces all legislation coming out of Brussels, it is about time they honoured this one.
